speaker: Maya
text: Hey Raj, did you read the request from the client who runs the fintech startup in Toronto?
ipa: heɪ rɑːʒ, dɪd juː riːd ðə rɪˈkwɛst frəm ðə ˈklaɪənt huː rʌnz ðə ˈfɪntek ˈstɑːtʌp ɪn təˈrɒntəʊ?

speaker: Raj
text: Yes, I did. They want a dashboard that shows real-time analytics, right?
ipa: jɛs, aɪ dɪd. ðeɪ wɒnt ə ˈdæʃbɔːd ðæt ʃəʊz ˈrɪəl taɪm ˌænəˈlɪtɪks, raɪt?

speaker: Maya
text: Exactly. They also mentioned a compliance report, which is something we haven’t built before.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli. ðeɪ ˈɔːlsəʊ ˈmɛnʃənd ə kəmˈplaɪəns rɪˈpɔːt, wɪʧ ɪz ˈsʌmθɪŋ wi ˈhævənt bɪlt bɪˈfɔː.

speaker: Raj
text: I spoke to Kevin, who worked on a similar module last year. He gave me access to a repo that contains reusable components.
ipa: aɪ spəʊk tuː ˈkɛvɪn, huː wɜːkt ɒn ə ˈsɪmɪlə ˈmɒdjuːl lɑːst jɪə. hi ɡeɪv mi ˈæksɛs tuː ə ˈriːpəʊ ðæt kənˈteɪnz riːˈjuːzəbl kəmˈpəʊnənts.

speaker: Maya
text: That’s great. Did he also explain the export tool that we integrated for the legal team?
ipa: ðæts ɡreɪt. dɪd hi ˈɔːlsəʊ ɪksˈpleɪn ði ˈɛkspɔːt tuːl ðæt wi ˈɪntɪɡreɪtɪd fɔː ðə ˈliːɡl tiːm?

speaker: Raj
text: Not in detail, but I found the spec document which outlines the data flow. It helped me understand the logic behind the report builder.
ipa: nɒt ɪn ˈdiːteɪl, bət aɪ faʊnd ðə spɛk ˈdɒkjʊmənt wɪʧ ˈaʊtlaɪnz ðə ˈdeɪtə fləʊ. ɪt hɛlpt mi ˌʌndəˈstænd ðə ˈlɒʤɪk bɪˈhaɪnd ðə rɪˈpɔːt ˈbɪldə.

speaker: Maya
text: Nice. By the way, we have a partner company with which we collaborated last year. They built a GDPR dashboard that we might be able to adapt.
ipa: naɪs. baɪ ðə weɪ, wi hæv ə ˈpɑːtnə ˈkʌmpəni wɪð wɪʧ wi kəˈlæbəreɪtɪd lɑːst jɪə. ðeɪ bɪlt ə ˌʤiːdiːpiːˈɑː ˈdæʃbɔːd ðæt wi maɪt bi ˈeɪbl tuː əˈdæpt.

speaker: Raj
text: Good to know. Do you have the contact info of the person who led that project?
ipa: ɡʊd tuː nəʊ. duː juː hæv ðə ˈkɒntækt ˈɪnfəʊ əv ðə ˈpɜːsən huː lɛd ðæt ˈprɒʤɛkt?

speaker: Maya
text: Yes, I’ll introduce you. Her name is Tanya — she’s the data architect whose team handled encryption.
ipa: jɛs, aɪl ˌɪntrəˈdjuːs juː. hɜː neɪm ɪz ˈtænjə — ʃiːz ðə ˈdeɪtə ˈɑːkɪtɛkt huːz tiːm ˈhændld ɪnˈkrɪpʃən.

speaker: Raj
text: Perfect. Oh, and I noticed a few functions in our codebase which nobody has touched in months.
ipa: ˈpɜːfɪkt. əʊ, ənd aɪ ˈnəʊtɪst ə fjuː ˈfʌŋkʃənz ɪn aʊə ˈkəʊdbeɪs wɪʧ ˈnəʊbədi hæz tʌʧt ɪn mʌnθs.

speaker: Maya
text: We’re planning to clean up anything that isn’t being used. There’s a script which flags those files automatically.
ipa: wɪə ˈplænɪŋ tuː kliːn ʌp ˈɛnɪθɪŋ ðæt ˈɪznt ˈbiːɪŋ juːzd. ðɛəz ə skrɪpt wɪʧ flæɡz ðəʊz faɪlz ˌɔːtəˈmætɪkli.

speaker: Raj
text: Awesome. I also joined the forum where people discuss open-source monitoring tools. I’ll share any good ideas I find.
ipa: ˈɔːsəm. aɪ ˈɔːlsəʊ ʤɔɪnd ðə ˈfɔːrəm weə ˈpiːpl dɪsˈkʌs ˈəʊpən sɔːs ˈmɒnɪtərɪŋ tuːlz. aɪl ʃeə ˈɛni ɡʊd aɪˈdɪəz aɪ faɪnd.

speaker: Maya
text: That’s really helpful. It’s those little things that make our platform more reliable.
ipa: ðæts ˈrɪəli ˈhɛlpfʊl. ɪts ðəʊz ˈlɪtl θɪŋz ðæt meɪk aʊə ˈplætfɔːm mɔː rɪˈlaɪəbl.
